name: Guapira candanga
distribution: Brasília Distrito Federal (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);Goiás (Brazil West-Central, Brazil, Southern America);
remarks: doi:10.1600/036364420X15801369352441 The specific epithet honours the migrants who worked to construct the Distrito Federal in the 1950s, especially those from the Northeast Region of Brazil, who were called candangos.

name: Guapira siqueirae
distribution: Espírito Santo (Brazil Southeast, Brazil, Southern America)
remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.460.2.4 The epithet honors Geovane de Souza Siqueira, curator of the herbarium CVRD.

name: Neea bradeana

remarks: doi:10.11646/phytotaxa.644.1.2 Etymology: the specific epithet honours Alexander Curt Brade (1881–1971), a prolific German born botanist based in Brazil who was the first to mention the taxon described here as a new species.
